text.section: In this subtitle the following words have the meanings indicated.

"Bail bond" means a written obligation of a defendant, with or without a surety or collateral security, that:
is conditioned on the appearance of the defendant as required; and
provides for the payment of a penal sum according to its terms.
"Bail bondsman" means an authorized insurance producer of a surety insurer.
"Collateral security" means any property deposited, pledged, or encumbered to secure the performance of a bail bond.
"License" means a license issued by the Commissioner to provide bail bondsman services.
"Provide bail bondsman services" means to provide any service in the bail bondsman trade.

section.section: "Surety" means a person, other than the defendant, that guarantees the appearance of the defendant by executing a bail bond.
"Surety" includes an uncompensated or accommodation surety.

text.section: "Surety insurer" means a person that, for compensation, directly or through an authorized insurance producer, acts as a surety on a bail bond.
